title: Five Stars

title: Dont overload the physical device or it will crash
body: Basically, if you load a little over 3 gbs of music on this device you will end up with a"DB error please remove X MB", but u cant because the. Omputer can no longer recognize the device because the drive has horribly corrupted files. This happened to me about four months after my purchase.

title: I like that it clips on
body: It's alright, as with the other SanDisk I have, I have to reformat it from time to time because it will just stop working.  I have about two and a half days of music on it.  I like that it clips on, no bulky armband.

title: Tough MP3 player.
body: I bought one of these things on ebay from Sep 29, 2013 for $22.99. My screen started dying a few days ago, but considering how cheap it was then, and how I opened it several times in order to fix the little auxiliary input thing (I was trying to keep the aux thing in place using an index card, but then I finally bought a soldering iron), this is a pretty long lasting item.

title: ... ton of music and all the EQ setting work great. The main down sides that I have found ...
body: It holds a ton of music and all the EQ setting work great. The main down sides that I have found with this MP3 Player is the battery life, which is deceptively short if you change the songs a lot and the folder setting are a bit wonky.The fact that you can charge it is a huge bonus though so you won't need to buy a ton of AAA batteries.

title: Great value for the storage
body: Great value for the storage.  Had a problem with my computer not recognizing the device so I was not able to recharge, but it fixed itself.

title: Great quality, Great sound
body: Great quality, Great sound, very light and very small. Was not immediately obvious how to copy music files from computer to player to keep files in the same order (on the player). The manual is a joke; manual was not helpful in transferring files from PC to the player. You may want to search Youtube videos for quick "How To" to find out how to copy music files from computer (PC) to this device. Overall, player has good quality and sound. Would recommend for gym. Once you figure out how to use and transfer files, you will probably fall in love with this little player. Also, it has some other features like FM radio, microphone recording, etc., but I did not use those features.

title: I love this litle Sansa device
body: I love this litle Sansa device. It is simple, recognizable by Win 10 and it does what it suppose to do without any extras. What really sucked about this is the software provided for D/L, which is complete crap, unneeded, confusing and just pure beeass. All you need is to plug it into the USB, it will be recognized, copy the music/books, create a playlist = PROFIT.This product gets my 100% and -1k for the software.I would recommend this for working out, running, etc ,etc.

title: perfect
body: Basic, easy to use, just what I need. The clip is whats sells it, for me, as I use when running. It's the first thing to break, which is my only complaint. But I expect it, and the clip lasts a good amount of time. I'm sad it's been discontinued.

title: I love running w this thing
body: better than sansa clip sport !!!i just replace the headphones for another for running. but the mp3 player is the Best by far !!!

title: Dead after 3 months
body: My computer will no longer recognize it.  Sansa software will no longer recognize it.  I bought it in May and now it it useless just 3 months later.

title: Three Stars
body: Okay I guess

title: perfection.
body: holds a lot of songs (with a big card), easy to use, works with linux, lasts through a 10 hr. work day, sounds good.i strongly advise getting the rubber protector for this to keep the sd card safe.

title: I still use my old Clip+ while out on runs and it performs like a champ
body: Got this to replace an old Clip+ that finally bit the dust from my SO literally sleeping on it every night for a couple years while listening to audiobooks. I can only assume putting that much strain on the headphone jack didn't do the circuit board many favors, so I don't fault the unit for that. I still use my old Clip+ while out on runs and it performs like a champ.My one gripe is that, for a product that literally is called "Clip+", the clip sucks. Any by that I mean it breaks very quickly and leaves jagged plastic behind afterwards. There is no way to replace the broken clip, as it breaks at the joint on the main body, so it mainly just becomes a standard (but small) MP3 player. As long as you have a pocket, you're fine, but it seems a bit odd to market something with a clip that breaks in a matter of months under moderate use (clipped to shorts or shirt while running... which is kinda the point). SanDisk should probably beef up the plastic a bit or make a replaceable clip assembly.

title: Super cheap alternative to i-Pod
body: If you try to compare it to an i-Pod, then just stop.  It's not an i-Pod.  It's a no frills, cheap alternative that's a bit tough to navigate around but still a good product.  The fact that I can add a 32 sandisk in there to increase song capacity is really nice too.

title: Two Stars
body: ok quality

title: Started out great, I received the item on 10 June
body: Started out great, I received the item on 10 June, used the item daily until it fried itself on 24 August.  I wore it attached to my shirt outside, guess the item has temperature issues, it stopped working 10 weeks to the day I started using it, if the temperature causes this much difficulty, it should not be sold as an item to be used in an outside environment only in inside A/C temperature controlled gym..

title: I absolutely love this little thing
body: I absolutely love this little thing! It does everything it needs to and nothing it doesn't. The ability to add a micro SD card makes me love it that much more. It's such a shame it's been discontinued by SanDisk. I will never buy an iPod or be forced to used iTunes for any of my media. I simply can't understand how or why Apple has a stranglehold on the media player market, especially when there are (were) great devices like the Sansa Clip+.

title: Good design
body: Great little player.  The clip makes this thing indispensable.  Nice display.

title: I had one previous that worked very well. I ...
body: I had one previous that worked very well. I know that this is a warehouse deal, but the 3mm jack does not fit in the slot well, making the connection to headphones or auxillary ports unstable....

title: Four Stars
body: My wife love this Sandisk player...excelent player...

title: GREAT PRICE!!! GREAT PRODUCT!!!
body: VERY GOOD PRODUCT

title: Four Stars
body: i like it

title: Great compact MP3 player
body: Can't live without. Great compact MP3 player.

title: and I still love it and use it during my workouts
body: I've had this thing for a couple of years now, and I still love it and use it during my workouts! Yes, i have a smart phone that I can put music on and listen to with cool bluetooth headphones, but I just love how compact and easy to use this thing is. And the battery life is fantastic, needing charged once every other week or so with my usage pattern! (Suck that, smartphone!)It uses a mini-USB connection to charge and to connect to a computer. It also has a slot for a micro-SD card (sorry, don't recall the maximum size for that).It boots up quickly and shuts down smartly if I leave it on accidentally. The screen is small, but big enough to see what I'm listening too and to navigate the easy to use menu system (and is in color, too).It's a great, solid little product and--most importantly--IT'S PURPLE!!! (Yes, that was a serious consideration for my purchasing of it. :P) If all you want is quick, easy music then this is most definitely the product for you! If you want pictures and movies and bluetooth and internet, then go get a smartphone or a tablet. I'll tell you though, this thing weighs next to nothing so doesn't slow me down while jogging and, perhaps second best of all (best being purple!), no one would rob me for it (unless they really like purple, as I do).

title: Five Stars
body: Best Mp3 player for overdrive audio books borrowed from our library

title: Easy to operate
body: This is my second one. First one dropped and landed directly on the button, breaking it. So, BE CAREFUL!Easy to operate, great sound for price.

title: but one I have now works great. FM tuner and recorder very good
body: I killed one a few years ago (they don't go swimming), but one I have now works great. FM tuner and recorder very good. 32g card is awesome on shuffle.

title: Secret Weapon
body: My secret weapon against boredom! So fabulous to have books on tape available all the time. Used daily. Had to google some things before I figured out how to download from the library. Now I am enjoying it daily....

title: Like the simple features and easy to play
body: Every member of our family has one! Like the simple features and easy to play.

title: An ideal workout buddy
body: This player is perfect if you like to listen to music during your workouts or just want to be "off the grid" for a little while and not be chained to your smartphone or computer. It's TINY and super light, the clip is strong, the battery life is really good, and, most importantly, sound if fantastic! If you are looking for something with an internet access, then this player is not for you. It also sometimes can get "stuck" on larger music files (ie, it will take it a moment to move on to playing said music file). Other than that, it's the best bang for your buck if a compact source of music is all you are looking for.

title: One Star
body: Guys I got 5 of these off amazon one of them was refurbished. and 4/5 failed so far.

title: nice MP3
body: I'm just happy I now have a MP3 that works and is easy to use.

title: Oh, no! Don't stop making these!!
body: I am CRUSHED that Sandisk has made the TERRIBLE decision to stop making the Clip +! This player has been a mainstay for me for years. I have many of them, love their look, feel, and reliability... something conspicuously absent from the newer versions (judging by the reviews). I wrote to Sandisk to complain, saying how great the Clip + is, especially since it has a superb recording function and can play audiobooks without issues. The guy wrote back and asked me what features I like about the Clip+ so he can recommend a newer version. I just TOLD you what I like!I notice that the company has copious time to reply to every single negative comment made about the (seemingly) crappy new Clip Jam. Why can't they just spend that time either making a superior product or just making sure long-time consumers are getting what they want? In a tiresome world where built-in obsolescence has become a religion for techies, who seem to think that newer is always better, I was impressed by Sandisk's commitment to keeping this awesome MP3 player out there. Now I will have to look at other products instead.I wish all the people who love this product would take the time to complain to the manufacturer about their sad decision. Maybe they would reconsider!

title: Five Stars
body: Excellent, reliable device, sounds good.

title: One Star
body: stop working after 4 months  very disappointed

title: Five Stars
body: Been a great product. Love it.

title: One Star
body: Died after 3 months of use.

title: Five Stars
body: I LOVE this thing!

title: You get what you pay for
body: Works pretty good until it doesn't. I guess a $50 mp3 is only meant to work for about 3 months. My $400 mp3 player worked for 8 years. I should have bought another one of those.

title: Five Stars
body: Love my MP3 player!

title: JUNK!!
body: Do not buy this product, I used it 3 times in my car and the 4th time it just stopped working.  Everything I plug it into says that there are no music files found.  Piece of junk, I bought a $14 mp3 from Office Depot that's worked for years no problem.

title: Works Like A Charm for Music in the Car -- Why'd they Stop Making This???
body: Hey, great little music player! Why did they stop making it??? Probably because so many people are using their smartphone or i-Whatever to play music. Not us! We want a dedicated music player to take into our vehicles, and this is it. We have 2 x vehicles made before mini-stereo-jacks were standard in most car radios, so we had no way to plug-and-play our MP3 tracks in our vehicles. We have CD players in both, but that gets old -- having to haul them around. Plus, the songs don't shuffle. SO we bought a couple of FM tuners that the SanDisk Clip plugs into, and that solved the problem. I put a velcro dot on the back and attached it in a convenient spot on each dashboard.So far, I've dumped about 2,000 songs in this tiny device, and it's working great! I just got the SanDisk Ultra 32 gig Ultra card, and I can't imagine that I'll ever run out of playlists or songs.Too bad they stopped making this!Having fun with it -- recommended!

title: The best little MP3 player
body: The best little MP3 player there is.  Lightweight and perfect for workout. Expandable memory SD slot allows for huge memory expansion. The following generation players are snazzy, but not nearly as convenient.

title: Perfect player. Hate they've quit making it
body: Perfect player.  Hate they've quit making it.

title: Absolutely brilliant mp3 player for running
body: I bought this mp3 player over three years ago after getting frustrated with my iPod nano – all I wanted was the ability to drag and drop music from my laptop onto a player that I can use for running every day.And that is exactly what I’ve got, after three years of solid use and reliability I felt this product is deserving of a review.Things that I really like about this mp3 player:The ease of transferring mp3s – it really is just a case of drag and drop.The rechargeable battery – has great battery life and charges via USB from my laptop as I’m transferring files which is great.The clip function – the mp3 is small and clips into the waistband of my shorts for running every day, I am completely unaware of its presence physicallyThe size of storage - for my purposes I can fit all the songs I want on here and more to keep my running music fresh, with plenty of ‘back up’ songs available. The fact that you could insert a larger microSD to expand your storage is always good but I don’t think I’ll ever use this function.In terms of drawbacks, for my purposes, I really can’t think of any. If it broke tomorrow I wouldn’t hesitate in buying another. Would highly recommend.

title: Easy to use, good quality Mp3 player
body: This is a nifty device if you're looking for a low-cost Mp3 player. The Sansa Clip has all kinds of great reviews on tech websites, and I researched Mp3 players there thoroughly, before buying this device. It works well, is easy to use, and suits its purpose. Now, I no longer use it, as I have a smartphone that can play plenty of music, but when I did not possess said phone, I loved my Sansa Clip. I gave it to my mother, who is older and doesn't use a smart phone, and she likes it quite well.

title: Piece of sh*t
body: Awful purchase. Worked for a week and starts messing up. Sent in for a replacement and that one worked for a day until it started malfunctioning. Sent that one in and my replacement worked for two days before it started messing up again. Sent that one in and got my current one which is no better than any of the others. I'm going to send it in AGAIN and ask for a newer model. Whatever they are sending out now are duds. Don't buy this product.

title: Only Lasted Six Months Before Constant Freezing! Replaced it With the Apple iPod Nano
body: I gave this MP3 player as an inexpensive gift. Unfortunately, after about six months of daily use, it began freezing frequently requiring reboots to restore operation. Basically, the player can only play a few songs (at best) before freezing. It has basic features, sounds great, is small and portable, and worked fine initially. I gave an [[ASIN:B0097BEDTC Apple iPod Nano 16GB (7th Generation)]] as a replacement gift. I guess, you get what you pay for!UPDATE (August 20, 2015): I updated the player's firmware (per the SanDisk Support representative's comment to this review), but there was no improvement in operation.

body: Has a great sound but doesn't hold up well in the heat when exercising.  It shorts out and looses it charge very quickly.

title: Broke after a month of use
body: The size and basic function made it perfect for the gym. It is light and clips easily on to your clothes. I had it for about a month when it completely shut down. It stopped in the middle of a song and will not turn back on. My computer will not even recognize it. Very disappointed!!

title: really great. Unfortunately
body: This little mp3 player replaced my iPod shuffle about ~6 months ago and has been really, really great. Unfortunately, and the only reason why Im giving it 3 instead of 5 stars, is because it freezes on me consistently. Every few songs (considering it is a shuffle) I skip, it starts to freeze if I go a little too fast when skipping through the songs and sometimes the freezing time ranges from 1-10 minutes. It kind of pisses me off because I use it in the gym and blast my music to get into the zone and when it freezes, I need t wait for it to get back to playing. I don't know if its just mine or it happens to others but, its just a great hinder and disturbance in my lifting, mentally as well. Other than that, it's very loud and is very handy and I love it.

title: Other than that it works fine.

title: Two Stars
body: Don't like it. Shuts off after a full charge smh

title: Quit working first week

title: Five Stars
body: Cheaper and much better than ipod

title: This product has both good and bad features
body: This product has both good and bad features. First the good: it is not just an MP3 player - it will play many different digital formats including MP3, WAVE, AIFF, and several others, intermixed. The lossless formats allow the reproduction of sound waveforms with absolutely no waveform distortion or tone coloring, so the audio quality is as good as a CD player. It is intended for use with earbuds, but can also supply audio to a Hi-Fi system. It is tiny and very light, and will run for several hours on its internal battery. One bad characteristic is its GUI - there are many modes, options, and settings, so the menu tree is complex and not very user-friendly. Another problem is its battery charging circuit: if the battery is run down, you cannot run the player from the charger while the battery is charging. This is not a problem if you only listen to the audio when you are out jogging. Another problem is the USB connector, which is used both to charge the battery and load the audio tracks. This connector is tiny, but very sturdy, with a metal shell, but is not well supported inside the player. Unfortunately, my player was totally destroyed after I had used it for just a few months when the charger cord was accidentally jerked and the USB socket broke away from the motherboard inside.

title: Economical mp3 lightweight player
body: I use this for listening to podcasts. The menu browsing can be awkward and confusing to navigate. I am never sure where I am going to find the audio file I want to hear. I do not like the pc interface software so I copy files to a micro sd card and insert it. The player takes a minute or two to update the file matrix after loading the memory card. After that it plays quite well. The sound is good and solid. Battery will discharge if you forget to fully power the player off when not in use. Otherwise it plays fine for my four hour work shift.

title: SANDISK MP3 PLAYER
body: Player is well designed and works properly.  The device is very small.  Information displayed on the device is also small.  This is a concern when operating dangerous machinery such as an automobile.  Decide for yourself if small size is good or bad . . .

title: Okay while it lasted...
body: Died after less than 12 months of purchase. Won't play any music, just sits on the home screen at first. Now it won't even power on -- tried charging it for a prolonged period of time but to no avail.Don't waste your money on this POJ! I truly got what I paid for, now my daughter is out of an MP3 player. But thankfully, a BLU Studio X smartphone from Amazon has fulfilled that need.

title: Great Player until it breaks
body: I have owned 6 or more Sansa Clips and Clip+ over the years. But My last unit, purchased on May 20, 2015 has a broken Volume Up button. These players have been bullet-proof for more than 10 years until recently. My last Sansa Clip+ failed in less than a year after the Power On/Off button became unresponsive. When these players work they cannot be beat for combination of low price, high capacity, LONG battery life, small size. I depend on my MP3 players for 10 hours per day. I baby them and protect them, and all but my last 2 Sansa Clip+ have lasted several years, they still work well. I've lost 2 or 3, and even my oldest player is nearly new, slightly shortened battery life after more than 5 years of daily full-time listening.

title: SanDisk Sansa clip is a POS
body: I bought this product and received it on 12/1/14.  It worked great up until today. I was listening to music and then the sansa went dead.  There is no life in it and when I hook it up to be charged nothing happens.  The Sansa was never mishandled/dropped and it just stopped working.  I called Sansa and I was told that they would replace the product with another 8mb Sansa product but that it would take a few weeks for me to get the product.  After reading a couple other Sansa reviews, I'd have to say that the SansaDisk is cheaply made.  I can only hope that the replacement I receive works better than this one.  I don't think that I'd buy this again.

title: After 9 months of usage, it just stop working ...
body: After 9 months of usage, it just stop working. Cant power on and cant charge for no reason. Think will get a reputable brand in future. This one is just too unreliable

title: Great product.
body: Great battery life. Weight is very low which is perfect for running. Only complaint is it is slightly poor at organising music.

title: This is not a good product at all.
body: I di not like this at all, after about 10 day this product will not hold a charge at all. It sucks......

title: Two Stars

title: Five Stars
body: This is my second Sansa Clip, I only bought another after 5+ years.

title: 1st Order was defective. Used the replaced (2nd order) for 2 months and it doesn't work anymore!!!
body: I used to have a Sansa clip, and love this model, so I decided to get another one. My first order was defective because the earphone jack was too small for any standard headphones to fit! I had to return the item, and the item was replaced free of charge. I did receive the second order, and now the replaced Sansa doesn't work anymore! I've only had it for 2 months!! This is ridiculous. The Sansa Clip I used to have years back was much more durable than these. Looks like the quality's gone down! This is very upsetting and I hope to be contacted to get this resolved!!

title: Works great, for about a month
body: Works great, for about a month, then it will lock up while loading new media, to the point that even holding down the power button to hard boot doesn't work, and you'll have to either wait for the battery to run out, or wreck the case prying it open to remove the battery.  I bought two of these, and each suffered from the same problem.

title: Five Stars
body: Player was as described and arrived promptly.  Thanks again.

title: Good not great covering for the Clip
body: This is a fine cover for the SanDisk Sansa Clip plus. It fits the Clip like a glove. It goes on easily and comes off quickly as well. It only offers some scratch and ding protection, definitely no protection from serious drops. There is no covering on the screen at all, which is disappointing. Otherwise a decent little jacket for the Clip.

title: Two Stars
body: Not a big fan, wouldn't buy again.

title: SCREW THE IPHONE6, BUY THIS!!!!!
body: The best music player I have ever had (compared to an iPhone 6) this device is simple to use and the PERFECT SIZE. I love the color of it, as well! So easy to download music (just drag and drop into a file called MP3) and has enough memory to get the basic songs I like on there plus some! And if you run out of space you can buy an extra memory chip and put it in there. The battery lasts so long as well! Is durable too! Would buy this over and over again. Love sandisk! Great quality playback as well! Screw my iPhone, Im using this mp3 player as my main music listening device! Overly happy customer! Thank you! Xoxo- Emily Tannehill

title: Good MP3 For The $
body: Nice little mp3 for the cash. Does everything you need it to do and little bit more. Has mp3, recorder, fm radio. It can also hold pictures and videos but does not have camera. I have used this mp3 once but overall, it seems to work well enough for us. It is smaller though.

title: Great for Audio Books
body: I am an avid audio book "reader," and I want a dedicated device for that. (I never use my phone for books because I don't want to run the battery down.) I have had several of these amazing little Sansa Clips. People are always surprised when I pull it out of my pocket and say, "I have 30 books on here." I'm an long-time Audible subscriber and also download books from my public library through OverDrive. It's effortless to do with this device. The sound quality is wonderful. And it's very competitively priced. One nice feature in using this for audio books is that I can adjust the speed. People can hear and comprehend speech faster than people can read aloud, so I can set it on fast, and cover more pages in less time. For a person like me who is dyslexic, this has been a God-send. I have an small speaker I can plug it into if I don't want to wear ear phones and I can also plug it into my car stereo system. I am always amazed at people who spend a good deal of time in a car every day who don't listen to audio books. What an opportunity they are missing. And when I recommend audio, I always pull my Sansa Clip out of my pocket to show them. (I have had several models and never been disappointed.)

title: I've been hunting for a item like this for a long time and I'm very happy ...
body: I've been hunting for a item like this for a long time and I'm very happy with this item.It males the long walk for work bearable.I've had this for a few months now and it is still going strong.Battery life is great as well.All in all it is great mp3.There is a issue that sometimes it turns off and wont come back on forcing me to do a reset but it is a quick fix.I would still recommend it.

title: Five Stars
body: GOOD PRODUCT

title: this is the greatest thing ever
body: If you can figure it out, this is the greatest thing ever, flash drive, so no moving parts, excellent sound, featherweight, and holds more tunes that you could ever need. If you need more, then just get another one. charges us via usb on pc, I'd prefer a more direct charge system. Oriented toward mp3 and the whole cloud grabbing bit, but I downloaded wmas off my pc from cds for the superior fidelity, but it lowers capacity, somewhat. Navigates fines. If you like simple and effective gadgets, this is for you, if you are more twee, then go find your exotica elsewhere.

title: Rethink...
body: I've had many iterations of Sansa, and this is the worst. The battery drains twice as fast as my old one and it frequently has to be rebooted on my computer as the tracks get snarled (can't think of a more tech appropriate term). It has a huge amount of memory, though!

title: This is super marvelous, and I bought another one for another ...
body: This is super marvelous, and I  bought another  one for  another friend, so  she could  enjoy  it.

title: Don't waste your
body: Totally faked out on this product.  Don't waste your money

title: Expensive but worth it to me
body: Paid through the nose for this thing as they no longer make them but I loved my other two so much that to me it was worth it.I'm not tech savy and this MP3 player is so easy to load and use I just couldn't be bothered learning another one.

title: Horrible for the gym
body: The ear buds are too big for the unit therefore with every movement the playing stops. Horrible for the gym.

title: Disappointed!!!
body: Sansa has taken a big step down. The device with the circular (round) controls worked so much better!!!This device did not last very long. It started giving me problems from the first week. The device would freeze in the middle of a song. Sometimes I had to reboot the device to get it to work again (while driving!!!) Thank God mp3's come with most smart phones. They work better.

title: really like this mp3
body: Great little player. I've purchased several for others. Just wish playlists were easier to set up. I made one to separate out Christmas music during the holidays and the Christmas songs still ended up mixed in with my regular music as well as being on a separate playlist. Really weird. Nothing like jamming out to whatever only to be interrupted by Jingle Bells in June.....

title: The battery died more quickly than my older Santa Clip ...
body: The battery died more quickly than my older Santa Clip.I use this at work in a lab, often clipped to my jeans or jacket pocket. Buttons are sometimes accidentally bumped (if I forget to lock), but they're not as sensitive as some players. I listen to a lot of podcasts. If you accidentally hit the skip forward button on a podcast, this player saves your place on the one you just left.

title: stopped working after 9 months
body: i was excited about this little inexpensive player. my kids were over the moon to get it for Christmas and have loved it, but have definitely not used it enough for it to quit working just 9 months later. bummed

title: Great even if it cost more
body: This is my third one - the small size is quite convenient except it makes losing it easier. FM radio, recorder, the ability to store and search for files in a hierarchical menu as opposed to by performer or category which my son's Zen insists upon. With 8 GB micro SD there's plenty of room. I have had some issues with the buttons not always doing what they're supposed to, but those have been only occasional glitches that are resolved by turning it off and on again (can you tell I'm used to Windows?)

title: Great value and a great potable player.
body: I was looking for a small lightweight digital audio player to take to the gym with me.  The Sansa Clip+ has fit the bill perfectly.  The bonus of being able to install rockbox is a pleasure, and the controls and display work flawlessly.  For the money, I haven't found any similar item that is its equal.  Highly recommended.

title: One Star
body: stop working

title: No-Frills. Love it!
body: This is my second Sansa Clip. The only reason I bought this one is because my first one was a 2 gig and I need more space now. The first one I purchased is still in perfect working order however.I love the simple no-frills design of this device. I don't need videos or album art or any other features - just an mp3 player that plays my music and audio books.This one has a slot for a micro SD card which comes in handy since I have A LOT of music and audio books to tote around with me. The battery life from a single charge is about 10-15 hours in my experience. I can usually get two solid business days out of it  (primarily use it at work).I highly recommend this device for a straight-forward no-frills mp3 player. It's USB so you don't need any software to run it, which is also a plus as this doesn't limit its use to Windows users.

title: Five Stars
body: good deal

title: Not nearly as good as older version of Sansa mp3 player
body: Not pleased. Had 5he older version of this product and I thought it was dying after several years of constant use as audio book player. This new version is really too small but I kept it and loaded audio books to it. One very important thing she using mp3 player for books ias that it keeps the place in the book from one use to another. This feature worked OK for a couple of months but then quit working. I called customer support and they told me two things to do that didn't work. Final option was total reboot which wiped out 6 books I had loaded. I put those books on my old player and low and behold it is working fine and have been using it several months now. Haven't gone back to new player but probably will have to if old one dies. Newer is not always better. Too bad they can't just keep making a product and quit trying to update it

title: Exactly as expected. Product description was spot on and ...
body: Exactly as expected.  Product description was spot on and the product functioned as well as it should have.  I would not hesitate to buy again.

title: Three Stars
body: Having lots of trouble with it

title: I don't know it if was a glitch on the one I received or if they are all like that. Very disappointed
body: I cannot put any ear phones into the SanDisk Sansa Clip+ that I received (included the earphones sent with it). I don't know it if was a glitch on the one I received or if they are all like that. Very disappointed. Had to send it back.

title: Four Stars
body: Great little MP3 player. good price and easy to use

title: Four Stars
body: still new but working great

title: Now I do my yard work and listen to a ...
body: Now I do my yard work and listen to a book at the same time. No worries about returning the audio book to a lender.

title: Good product, good service.
body: Good product, good service.

title: Five Stars
body: Cute

title: Five Stars
body: Great battery life. Good display. Absolutely no issues with it. Great device.

title: Listen up !
body: Great buy, very happy with equipment.

title: Five Stars
body: Awesome

title: Probably good for most, but failed me
body: I used the Sansa Clip to download various verbal presentations spoken at different meetings. It worked very well and I enjoyed the manner in which I was able to determine how to basically operate it even without specific written instructions. I could not figure out how to download the verbal recordings into their own "folder" and music downloads into their own "folders".  I am an older man that is not nearly as digitally competent as younger individuals and this probably is the reason why I had difficulty. The instructions were too limited for me, as I think SanDisk thinks everyone is now so familiar with the latest digital technology that specific written instructions would be redundant. Too bad, as I suspect many of their customers fall into the same category as me. But, the main reason I gave it a three star was because it completely quit working after roughly a month of very limited use. Amazon did credit my account with the full purchase price when I sent it back to them and this encouraged me to purchase more items through them in the future.

title: Superb music player.
body: Best music player! I loved this item so much that this unit is my second (the first one still works -- and that's from YEARS ago -- a 4GB blue-colored model), but this is an 8GB unit that is my new primary player. I'm using the old one as a back up. I did this because I read that SanDisk no longer manufactures this model.I highly recommend this music player!

title: Very lightweight and good to take running
body: This is the second one we have purchased.  You can't beat its compact size.  Very lightweight and good to take running.

title: Battery garbage!
body: I ordered this as a Fathers Day gift, he had it less then 2 months and the battery will NOT charge. I have tried to get a replacement but see no place where Amazon offers this. Very disappointed in this product!

title: Five Stars
body: Love this thing

title: Poor design with ear piece connection
body: My SanDisk clip was supposed to be a replica of my old one, which I had lost at the gym. I purchased directly from Amazon to minimize any risks but knowing the warning that said manufacturer had discontinued product. As the instructions in booklet were very schematic, I had to call their support line, which was pretty helpful as a person responded relatively quickly and was able to help me.I was able to load music to it with no problem. However, the main disadvantage is the ear piece they supplied. The insert does not fit snuggly into the player as it is too big. Yes, you can get music but the most minute vibration (walking, sitting, getting in and out of car) will cause a disconnect, sometimes momentary but many times requiring you to manually jiggle the insert to reconnect again. A major hassle that ruins the experience as you do not want to be listening to music that stops every few seconds while you are simply walking or exercising. Such a simple design to get right and yet not done. Do they want to sell additional peripherals? Now I will either have to return entire product or buy other ear pieces.Otherwise this is small and functional player for MP3 and other media.

title: Shuts off randomly
body: I bought this when it was much cheaper ($34.99). It is a decent little player, but lately it has been randomly shutting off during play despite having a full charge, which is a moderate inconvenience.

title: FM Recording capability and so much more!
body: They honestly don't make them like this anymore!  I've tried it a few times and it works great!  What sound!  I can't believe they stopped making this.  I guess downloading is what people do, but recording from FM is still necessary.

title: Great, But Easily Lost/Misplaced
body: Great little item, as long as you don't lose it--I've lost three so far, so I've stopped buying them (I lost them because the device is so little).

title: Decent, though faulty MP3 player
body: I purchased this MP3 Player for one purpose only, to play library audiobooks in the car. This device meets my basic requirements - it is compact, it has decent sound and easy navigation and it holds a charge well. The only issue I have with audiobooks is that the tracks are out of order in the music library - tracks 10+ come before track 1. This is a relatively minor inconvenience, but it does require navigating back to track 10 after track 9. The other issue I have had is that my device will randomly shut down in the middle of playing for no discernible reason. When I turn it back on, it picks right back up where it left off, so while it is a nuisance, it isn't something that led me to return the device.

title: These don't last  -- dead in less than 2 months
body: I loved my first clip+ player like this but after years I lost it.  Ordered one of the newer versions directly but the clip was broken out of the box so I went back to my trusty old version but this one died after less than 2 months of very limited use.  I am so disappointed and now I have to find another small player and reload the music.

title: Five Stars
body: Love this little mp3, it's perfect for my needs!

title: Still using after 4 years!
body: It's been 4 years since I purchased 2 Sansa Clips as gifts for my wife and daughter. Both have moved on to iPods since then and I gladly inherited them - I had to update the firmware after a couple issues but that did the trick as they both work like a charm. I expanded the memory on one of them (holds more music than the 32GB iPod I gave my daughter!). I use one for music during workouts and the other for audiobooks. Advice: purchase a good set of headphones for great, clean sound. Even after 4 years, this has proven to be quite a useful and reliable device.

title: It only lasted 2 months, then wouldn't turn on ...
body: It only lasted 2 months, then wouldn't turn on anymore.  Was hard to get it to stop, start, fast forward and rewind from the beginning.  Wished I returned it right away when it was difficult to operate.  I waited too long and had to buy a new one....different model.

title: Five Stars
body: great sound...perfect size.. voice recorder is great..

title: I have only owned the Sandisk for 9 months and ...
body: I have only owned the Sandisk for 9  months and suddenly it just stopped working.It won't take a charge or plug into my computer. If this is the type of cheap product that Amazon endorses,shop elsewhere.

title: I got this for my mom in law and loaded ...
body: I got this for my mom in law and loaded ALOT of music on it and still have lots of memory left. She uses it alot and loves it.

title: Apparently SanDisk has discontinued this model and its replacement isn't as good. I don't know about the replacement models
body: I bought the Sansa Clip+ because of reviews I read on Amazon...thanks to all who wrote them, and steered me in the right direction. Apparently SanDisk has discontinued this model and its replacement isn't as good. I don't know about the replacement models, but this one (Sansa Clip+) is perfect; it works exactly like is should, holds a lot of data (in my case audiobooks), and the price was right. Thanks again to Amazon reviewers; your help is appreciated.

title: Five Stars
body: Happy with everything, no complaints.

title: Four Stars
body: my husband loved it

title: Five Stars
body: Good product, good attention, good seller, I recommend it.

title: Five Stars
body: Love this MP3 player.

title: So Far, So Good!
body: This is the fourth player we've had. The others just quit. Players are so relatively low tech (inexpensive) that I calk the others up to hit or miss. Finally, I have a SanDisk that seems to work. I hope it holds up!

title: POS
body: Simple to use for my husband truck driver.  I download his library books a week at a time and he is able to get to them and listen to them.  UPDATE : POS Two months later and its dead, won't charge, won't play...nothing

title: More Disposable Junk
body: Although I am generally a Sandisk fan & appreciate the much simpler load-n-play operations -n- ez-2-use software over i-crap anything...I simply cannot endorse this particular MP3 Player... Since the very 1st week of use - it developed a vertical blue line down the middle of the screen (never dropped or exposed to water),... has always had a short battery life (couple hours of play) & now will not hold a charge @ only 10 months old... turns on - reads "low battery" and shuts right down... not impressive by any standards! However - that seems to be the case with many of these MP3 players and covers all 3 of our purchases on these devices thus far. It's a disposable world unfortunately with all the intense leaps -n- bounds within the tech world..... funny how this is possible while we still roll the wheel of the prehistoric fossil fuel industry  - wonder why that is - right..It is also astonishing and boggles the mind how our purchases of amazon supposed "best sellers" continually fail & disappoint us at all levels!

title: I love that it is small and easy to carry or ...
body: So I use this every day at my gym. I love that it is small and easy to carry or put away. I hate that there is no lock feature. Sometimes I or something bangs against it and the music stops or goes to the next song. This is very annoying. Otherwise I find it great and easy to use. Easy to upload music.

title: Junk
body: After 5 months the internal memory corrupted, No repair possible.  Nothing for it but to toss it in the trashl

title: Not a product I'd wish on an enemy.
body: Ordered this product and within a couple of weeks it would no longer turn on. LOTS of information online about different hoodoo and voodoo that can be done to bring it back to life and none of it worked. I returned for replacement thinking that it was just a one-off misfit. The second one started acting strangely within a couple of weeks and was still functioning most of the time so I kept it. The hello screen would not come on and the book/music last being listened to would start anyway. The menu and select buttons would simply stop working and then out of the blue 10 or 15 minutes later the whole thing would rapid fire through all commands it had previously gotten. At times the screen would flash goodbye and just shut down and when I turned it on it would be back where I had started it before, sometimes HOURS earlier. I should have given up then and mailed it back because there is a 30 day return policy and these have been discontinued by the manufacturer. I am right back where I started with the first one. NOTHING turns it back on. Occasionally plugging it in to a computer will prompt it to say goodbye or to indicate that it is charging, and no amount of reset or other commands bring it back to life. I'm an old person who is using this sitting still and plugging it in to charge in safe computers. It has only ever downloaded books from Audible. There is absolutely no reason to suspect that my lifestyle or use of this machine killed it. These are just VERY fragile and buggy and should not be purchased. Let the remaining stock be sent to people patient enough to keep trying to return and replace them. Find something better for your $70 and if you have already purchased one, do NOT tolerate the bugs. Replace as soon as it starts acting strangely or you're going to be out your money.

title: mistake
body: cannot download from my Macbook, should not have bought this.

title: I love this little music player
body: I love this little music player :)It organizes all the music for me and you can choose from Album, Artist, Genre, etc.It has a built in radio.and, probably one of the best things, it has a Micro SD slot for EXPANDABLE MEMORY!

title: Five Stars
body: I love this MP3 Player.  I have used it constantly during the past 2 years with no problems whatsoever.

title: Great buy!
body: This tiny mp3 maybe small but is large in use. Where else can you get a voice recorder, fm player, and mp3 player for $30? Great buy!

title: Three Stars
body: VERY difficult to use but its ok....

title: AMAZING DEVICE
body: This is the most awesome MP3 player ever devised!  Unlike the iFruit products, it can actually "play by folder" which is awesome as iPrunes will always screw up the categorization of at least 20% of my music!

title: I've bought a dozen of these. Some last for ...
body: I've bought a dozen of these. Some last for 2 years and some for 2 months. I'm done. They're junk

title: Nice Little Player
body: These are great little music players.  Life span is about 2-3 years and that is with great deal of use by active teens. I have bought three of these and they work really well.

title: Just clip it on and your ready for a good workout.
body: Love my Sansa Clip. I like to relax with my extensive playlist. The sound quality on this little player is great. Very easy to use.

title: Stay Away from SanDisk!
body: I bought this for my husband he loves it, so I bought it for myself too. 09/18/2015 UPDATE: Originally loved the item(s), but both Sansa Clips are now malfunctioning: Can't get either one to turn on. After several troubleshooting recommendations tried, I've given up! Will NEVER buy another SanDisk product EVER again!!

title: I ordered this to upgrade from my old SanDisk mp3 ...
body: I ordered this to upgrade from my old SanDisk mp3 player. I record convention sessions from the fm tuner feature. This new model does not pick up the broadcasf from the PA system. Very unhappy.

title: headphone jack won't allow headphones to insert all the way
body: The only reason "I hate it" is because the headphone jack does not accommodate ANY headphones. It's like every plug is too long. When I am running the headphones always pop out of the jack because the device does not allow m to push them all the way in.

title: Meets expectations
body: I put music in it, hit play and it sends the music to my headphones.  That's everything I wanted it to do, plus it's very small and clips onto my shirt.  Win.

title: Worth Every Penny
body: Great for the price. Your defiantly getting what you pay for and a little bit more. I hasn't failed me and the quality of it is impressive.

title: Five Stars
body: Works as advertized

title: and kind of liked it even though it's so small
body: I bought this clip 6 months ago, and kind of liked it even though it's so small. But after only these few months of light usage a fully-charged battery loses all of its charge in less than a hour. It's outside Amazon's return window so I'm not sure if I can get it replaced or if it's going into the trash.

title: My husband loves it!
body: I bought this for my husband. He just wanted a simple MP3 player and this fits the bill perfectly!

title: Five Stars
body: Very light and easy to operate. Exactly what I was looking for.

title: Disappointed
body: Bought this 2 months ago and it already died. For the cost, expected more.

title: Waste of money
body: This broke after using it for a couple months without trauma or anything... just stopped turning on. Waste of money.

title: SHORT LIFE SPAN
body: Bought this item in October of last year.  Died completely today.  According to the website, I am unable to get any compensation for it.  I would expect a product that I shelled out $70 for to last AT LEAST a year.  I'm incredibly disappointed and angry that my hands are tied.

title: ... years I forgot to write a review but i love it it works well
body: i have had this for years I forgot to write a review but i love it it works well. Doesnt take a long time to charge

title: great buy.
body: Second one I've owned and I love it.  Easy to program, easy to use, good quality.

title: very pleased
body: What can I say? This little device, being the size of a matchbox, can carry dozens of hours of music, lasts over two days on a full battery charge, and has survived two trips through the laundry. Also, it plays FLAC! Much of my music library is FLAC, so if you're like me this is what you should get.Why can't more compact portable music players be like this?

title: When it works it is great.
body: It is hard to get downloaded books to load on the book section.  Sometimes the chapters get scrambled.  When it works it is great.

title: This things the best bang for your buck value in MP3 players
body: This things the best bang for your buck value in MP3 players , 60+ gigs with micro sd card for under 50$  is ridiculous

title: Need new wire? This little guy lasted 5 years for me
body: I have had this for at least 5 years and it was excellent while it lasted.  I don't think the Sansa is broke because it still plays the music but my computer doesn't recognize it when I go to recharge, so I think it is only the wire/plug that came with it is broke.  This one is no longer made, so if I can't find the wire, I will have to get a newer version.Since Windows 10 will no longer support Music/DVD media, I want to get as many songs as I can on whichever device I get, be it this one or a newer one.This one was great for music.  I never really used much of the other stuff - recorder or audio books and the FM radio was fine but here in Boston, not one FM station plays oldies (1940's, 50's, 60's) as a dedicated station.  I found one on AM but I have to listen to him on a portable radio near a window -- even my stereo won't pick him up because it is not near a window -- imagine that.So,  since I can't find the wire (any help here please), I guess I will go with the newer version.

title: The best sound ever--I wish the texture of the headphones was ...
body: The best sound ever--I wish the texture of the headphones was better--they tend to stick to my neck and I have to constantly adjust.

title: Perfect
body: Small, simple to use and durable, everything I need to love this player.

title: Waste of money
body: Lasted just under two months and has now died completely. Waste of money.

title: Great product
body: It does everything I wanted it to do, glad I bought it. I put the Bible and two other books on it and still have 7gb left, plus I can add a 16gb chip if I start running low on storage.

title: PooPoo Caca Quality!
body: This SanDisk Sansa Clip worked for just one year until it froze and never turned on again! It's a piece of poopoo caca, and I hope SanDisk has enough cajones to stand behind their products! Please do not purchase this. Very disappointing!  >;(

title: Just love this product
body: This is the second one I've purchased. Just love this product. They do wear out after about 4 years, but I'm finding that is just how things are lasting nowadays.

title: Avoid these like the plague
body: If I could give less than one star, I would. Avoid these like the plague. No instructions included and even if you follow the ones you find on line, I was still unable to play the mp3s I loaded onto this thing.

title: Four Stars
body: It is what it is.

title: Excellent player
body: Don't underestimate this little audio/music/radio/book player. It can play very good sound. It has a micro SD slot so adding songs to this audio player is easy.

title: Five Stars
body: Buy the 8GB, my fault for buying the 4GB but works fine

title: Great price and MP3 player
body: Perfect for our 4 and 6 year olds!

title: One Star
body: Does not recognize external sd cards

title: good product
body: good product

title: Very nice MP3 player
body: Kids love it.  Long battery life, great sound quality.

title: These mp3 players sound better than iPods or any other players for that matter
body: These mp3 players sound better than iPods or any other players for that matter. It takes a little getting used to the controls, but once you understand them, it becomes a breeze to use when riding a bike, going for a walk, etc...

title: I don't want to have to crack the Davinci Code just to listen to music
body: After less than a year the player started to malfunction. To turn it on now you have to hit a series of buttons. I don't want to have to crack the Davinci Code just to listen to music. Junk. 1 star.

title: Five Stars
body: Very good and handy product.

title: Perfect little mp3 and radio player for working out
body: Perfect little mp3 and radio player for working out.  I specifically bought one with a radio for tuning into the TV's at the gym.I am very happy with it and bought one for my husband after he saw mine!

title: Four Stars
body: works very well

title: I like physical buttons
body: No bells or whistles here. It plays MP3s, that is all. As for its lack of touch screen, I praise that. I like physical buttons.
